mainOffice.address: Sundance Institute Headquarters 1500 Kearns Blvd, Suite B200 Park City, UT 84060 USA

eligibilityCriteria.criteria: Films exhibited outside their country of origin before February 3, 2025, are ineligible. Projects completed before January 1, 2023, are ineligible. Non-English projects must include on-screen English subtitles
Projects completed before January 1, 2023, are ineligible. Non-English projects must include on-screen English subtitles.
Projects completed before January 1, 2023, are ineligible. Non-English projects must include on-screen English subtitles.

festivalInfo.description: The Sundance Film Festival, founded in 1978 by Robert Redford, is a premier platform for independent films. It is held annually in Park City, Utah, in January. Sundance showcases a wide range of films, including features, documentaries, shorts, and experimental projects, often spotlighting diverse and innovative voices. It offers several prestigious awards, such as the Grand Jury Prize and Audience Award. Known for launching filmmakers' careers, Sundance provides industry professionals a chance to discover new talent and features educational programs with a growing online presence through Sundance Now.
festivalInfo.name: Sundance Film Festival

featureFilm.criteria: Any narrative or non-scripted work of fiction originating from within the United States with a running time of 50 minutes or more.

internationalShortFilm.criteria: Any film or video project originating from outside of the United States with a running time of less than 50 minutes, including credits.

episodicContent (60min or less).criteria: Any live-action, documentary/nonfiction, or animation project presented in or intended to be presented in a multi-episode format.

episodicContent (60min or more).criteria: Any live-action, documentary/nonfiction, or animation project presented in or intended to be presented in a multi-episode format.
